advantage of a fire raging through the nearby headquarters of the ruling National Democratic Party in downtown Cairo, intruders climbed the gates, broke a window and entered the museum in bid to steal the mummies. But demonstrators in collaboration with security forces stopped the thieves and returned the relics to the museum-- but they were already damaged, Zahi Hawass said. to speed up decision-making at the Internet giant. In a regulatory filing last week, Google Inc. said that Eric Schmidt in December drew up a plan to sell some of his stock in the company. The pre-arranged trading plan was adopted in order to allow Eric Schmidt to sell a portion of his Google Inc. stock as part of his long-term strategy for individual asset diversification and liquidity, the filing said. As of December 31, Eric Schmidt had about 9.2 million shares of Google Inc. stock and controlled 9.6 percent of the company's voting power. Eric Schmidt plans to sell about 534,000 shares of Class

The ramifications were so great that, as the head of this department of 3 million people, I felt compelled to step forward to take responsibility for the institutional failure. As I began to come to terms with what had happened at Abu Ghraib, the events left me feeling punched in the gut. Yet President Bush refused to let Donald Rumsfeld go. in Turkey, returned to the U.S. to have a lesion surgically removed from his right leg, spurring rumors he will retire. Allen Iverson denies this, as he wrote on his Twitter account: I have never said anything about retirement, nor have I said goodbye to the game of basketball. Once I get past this, my plan is to continue playing at the highest level possible. So don't put me in my rocking chair just yet. Hold on, I'll be back! It's not yet known if the lesion is benign or not, or if it's a cyst. Allen Iverson , 35, is expected to be out for several weeks
